title: Plan infra + deployment workflow (DO + GitHub Actions)
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Goal
- Review available bd formulas (e.g., shiny, shiny-secure, shiny-enterprise) and map them to this project's deployment workflow.

Scope
- Provisioning plan for a DigitalOcean droplet (networking, OS baseline, users/SSH, firewall, TLS).
- CI/CD plan using GitHub Actions (build/test, deploy steps, secrets management, rollback).
- Observability plan (logs, metrics, traces, alerting, dashboards) appropriate for a small streaming service.
- Environment strategy (dev/staging/prod), config and secrets handling.

Deliverables
- A written plan (markdown) with recommended formula choice(s) and rationale.
- Step-by-step setup + deploy checklist for initial bootstrap and ongoing releases.
- Open questions and assumptions that need human decisions.

title: Refinery Patrol
description: Merge queue processor patrol loop with verification gates.

title: Witness Patrol
description: Per-rig worker monitor patrol loop with progressive nudging.

title: Test Web client streaming receiver
description: Write and run tests. Unit tests for new code, integration tests if needed, run the full test suite, fix any regressions.

title: Confirm environment parameters
description:
Decide the environment settings and deployment approach.

Collect and confirm:
- env (staging/production)
- domain + tls_email
- do_region + droplet_size
- ssh_key_fingerprint
- deploy_method (container/artifact)
- udp_port_range for streaming
- repo + branch
- optional: stun_server, turn_config

Exit criteria: parameters are agreed and recorded in the issue or notes.
notes: Params: env=production, domain=stream.winnowscout.com, tls_email=michael@nef.net.au, do_region=syd1, droplet_size=s-1vcpu-1gb, ssh_key_fingerprint=SHA256:NI7BqeaoEg3hEnoEiRgi28absWt23CX565lO1K6wMl4, deploy_method=artifact, udp_port_range=10000-20000, repo=https://github.com/MouseAndKeyboard/3d-streamer, branch=main, stun_server=unset, turn_config=unset, do_project=none. Cloudflare DNS via CLOUDFLARE_API_KEY.

title: Review implementation
description: Review the implementation. Check for: Does it match the design? Are there obvious bugs? Is it readable and maintainable? Are there security concerns?

title: mol-streamer-infra
description:
Infra + deployment workflow for the streamer server stack.

This formula provisions DigitalOcean infrastructure, hardens the host, deploys
custom C server code (including a UDP streaming service), configures TLS +
reverse proxying, and wires CI/CD for automated deploys.

Note: CI/CD may use the GitHub repo secret DIGITAL_OCEAN_KEY (DigitalOcean API
key) for provisioning and environment monitoring.

title: Set up CI/CD workflows
description:
Create GitHub Actions workflows for CI + deploy.

Include:
- CI build/test
- Deploy staging on main
- Deploy production via manual gate/tag

Use DIGITAL_OCEAN_KEY in workflows if automated provisioning or monitoring is
required.

Exit criteria: workflows exist and secrets are wired.

title: Baseline OS hardening
description:
Harden the OS and access model.

Tasks:
- Create deploy user with sudo
- Disable root SSH and password auth
- Enable unattended security updates
- Ensure NTP is enabled

Exit criteria: SSH access is locked to keys and updates are enabled.

title: Test Streaming backend server
description: Write and run tests. Unit tests for new code, integration tests if needed, run the full test suite, fix any regressions.

title: Configure firewall rules
description:
Configure DO firewall + UFW with minimal openings.

Allow:
- TCP 22 from trusted IPs
- TCP 80/443 for web + signaling
- UDP 10000-20000 for WebRTC + custom UDP server

Deny all else by default.

Exit criteria: firewall rules are active and validated.

title: Design End-to-end streaming validation
description: Think carefully about architecture before writing code. Consider: How does this fit into the existing system? What are the edge cases? What could go wrong? Is there a simpler approach?

title: Submit for merge
description: Submit for merge. Final check: git status, git diff. Commit with clear message. Follow your role's git workflow for landing code.

title: Implement Streaming backend server
description: Write the code for Streaming backend server. Follow the design. Keep it simple. Don't gold-plate.

title: Design Streaming backend server
description: Think carefully about architecture before writing code. Consider: How does this fit into the existing system? What are the edge cases? What could go wrong? Is there a simpler approach?

title: Configure reverse proxy and static hosting
description:
Configure TLS and proxying for the client + signaling.

Tasks:
- Configure Caddy/Nginx for TLS on stream.winnowscout.com
- Proxy WebSocket signaling
- Serve static client assets

Exit criteria: HTTPS is valid and client loads correctly.

title: Review implementation
description: Review the implementation. Check for: Does it match the design? Are there obvious bugs? Is it readable and maintainable? Are there security concerns?

title: Deploy custom C server
description:
Build and deploy the custom C server (cube_server) as a systemd service.

Tasks:
- Build from repo
- Install binary and systemd unit
- Configure /etc/cube-server/env
- Enable and start service

Exit criteria: service is running and logs are healthy.

title: shiny: backend streaming server
description: Engineer in a Box - the canonical right way. Design before you code. Review before you ship. Test before you submit.

title: Test End-to-end streaming validation
description: Write and run tests. Unit tests for new code, integration tests if needed, run the full test suite, fix any regressions.

title: shiny: end-to-end streaming validation
description: Engineer in a Box - the canonical right way. Design before you code. Review before you ship. Test before you submit.

title: Install runtime dependencies
description:
Install base packages for the custom C server stack.

Examples:
- build tools (gcc/clang, make, cmake)
- GStreamer libs
- libwebsockets
- Caddy or Nginx

Exit criteria: required packages are installed and available.

title: Validate end-to-end streaming
description:
Run smoke tests against the live system.

Validate:
- HTTPS + WebSocket signaling
- WebRTC connectivity
- UDP streaming service reachability
- Basic playback in browser

Exit criteria: smoke tests pass and latency is acceptable.

title: shiny: frontend web client
description: Engineer in a Box - the canonical right way. Design before you code. Review before you ship. Test before you submit.

title: Deploy custom C UDP streaming service
description:
Build and deploy the custom UDP server as a systemd service.

Tasks:
- Build UDP server binary
- Install systemd unit
- Bind to configured UDP port range

Exit criteria: UDP service is listening and reachable.

title: Provision DigitalOcean infrastructure
description:
Provision the droplet and network baseline.

Tasks:
- Create droplet in do_region with droplet_size
- Attach SSH key by fingerprint
- Assign reserved IP (if used)
- Place droplet in a DO project

If automated, use DIGITAL_OCEAN_KEY via the DigitalOcean API:
https://docs.digitalocean.com/reference/api/digitalocean/

Exit criteria: droplet is reachable via SSH and has a stable IP.
notes: Droplet provisioned: id=545426630, name=ubuntu-s-1vcpu-1gb-syd1-01, region=syd1, status=active, public_ip=209.38.90.137. SSH verified as root (BatchMode).

title: Define rollback and runbook
description:
Document rollback and operational steps.

Include:
- How to roll back (image tag or artifact swap)
- Where logs live
- How to restart services
- Contact/escalation notes

Exit criteria: rollback steps are written and accessible.

title: Design Web client streaming receiver
description: Think carefully about architecture before writing code. Consider: How does this fit into the existing system? What are the edge cases? What could go wrong? Is there a simpler approach?

title: Configure GitHub environment secrets
description:
Create GitHub Environments (staging/production) and store required secrets.

Minimum secrets:
- SSH_HOST, SSH_USER, SSH_KEY
- DOMAIN, TLS_EMAIL
- DIGITAL_OCEAN_KEY (DigitalOcean API key)
- CLOUDFLARE_API_KEY (Cloudflare API token/key for DNS automation)
- CS_STUN_SERVER, CS_TURN_* (if needed)

Exit criteria: secrets exist in the correct environments.
notes: Confirmed production GitHub Environment secrets set: SSH_HOST, SSH_USER, SSH_KEY, DOMAIN, TLS_EMAIL, DIGITAL_OCEAN_KEY, CLOUDFLARE_API_KEY (STUN/TURN unset).

title: Implement Web client streaming receiver
description: Write the code for Web client streaming receiver. Follow the design. Keep it simple. Don't gold-plate.

title: Baseline observability
description:
Add basic logging + uptime checks.

Tasks:
- Ensure journald logs are retained
- Optional: node_exporter or simple metrics
- Add uptime check for HTTPS endpoint

Exit criteria: logs are accessible and health checks are active.

title: Implement End-to-end streaming validation
description: Write the code for End-to-end streaming validation. Follow the design. Keep it simple. Don't gold-plate.
